intro: Odontosiphon richardianum, commonly known as the richardian strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in the rainy season. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens.
